title: Kenya: Titus Naikuni Blames KQ Woes On Terrorism
text:
By Dennis Odunga 
Former Kenya Airways boss Titus Naikuni has denied involvement in corruption blaming the company's woes on terrorism. 
Mr Naikuni who appeared before the senate select committee said the company's troubles were caused by terror attacks that reduced passenger numbers. He said he is not aware of any form of corruption at the airline. 
The low passenger numbers affected the expansion plans of the company that had seen them invest in more planes, the former CEO said. 
KQ announced a full year loss of Sh25 billion shocking many and raising questions about how the company is run. 
Mr Naikuni also dispelled concerns that the KQ joint venture with KLM was favouring the Dutch airline at the expense of the national carrier saying that the profit sharing formula had improved from 40:60 to 50:50 under his tenure. 
He also defended the move to outsource staff, saying the move was within the international standards and that nobody was recruited illegally. Kenya
